page.title: 11Elsenham Quarry
page.content: The quarry was opened at the start of World War 2 (about 1940). It was first used to fill sand bags for the War. Nowadays though the quarry digs up building sand which is used for mortar. There are 44 men employed at the quarry and 1 lady typist. Altogether 250,000 tonnes of building sand is dug up a year and heat-sealed in 50kg bags. The machines dig down 15ft to 22ft. When the quarry closes down the whole 120 acres will be filled with rubbish. Then on top of the rubbish will be placed a layer of top soil and then the quarry will be returned to countryside for farmland.
